posts.post_content:
Perhaps the best thing about him is his ability to give unavoidable poison counters.
  
+1/+1 is a great thing for evasion like [Plague Stinger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Plague Stinger) or [Ichorclaw Myr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ichorclaw Myr) for the "should I block it?" clause,
  
Not to mention [Putrfax](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Putrfax) and a hasty [Skithiryx, the Blight Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skithiryx, the Blight Dragon).
  
He's an Infect 3/2, which is pretty solid.
  
But, he shines with his ability to allow you to cast your infect creatures, and give poison even if it's countered, destroyed, exiled, what have you,
  
That is what makes this guy so damn powerful.
posts.html:
Perhaps the best thing about him is his ability to give unavoidable poison counters.
+1/+1 is a great thing for evasion like Plague Stinger or Ichorclaw Myr for the "should I block it?" clause,
Not to mention Putrfax and a hasty Skithiryx, the Blight Dragon.
He's an Infect 3/2, which is pretty solid.
But, he shines with his ability to allow you to cast your infect creatures, and give poison even if it's countered, destroyed, exiled, what have you,
That is what makes this guy so damn powerful.

@flq-vandal:

No. Because it's when you cast a creature spell with infect. By the time he's entered the battlefield, he's no longer being cast.

This does also mean that the creatures don't have to enter the battlefield in order to trigger his effect. Which makes him pretty awesome.

posts.post_content: Thank you Wizards for a lovely pre-made GB poison curve: 1: [Vector Asp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vector Asp) (although he doesn't work with this guy quite right), 2: Your choice 2 mana Infect creature, 3: [Cystbearer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cystbearer), 4: [Hand of Praetors](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hand of Praetors), and topping off at 5: [Putrefax](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Putrefax). Add in some [Corpse Cur](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Corpse Cur) to sideboard against control and some [Throne of Geth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Throne of Geth) against agro; slant your mana base towards green, add some basic black removal, a dash of green pump, and you're good to go! :P
posts.html:
Thank you Wizards for a lovely pre-made GB poison curve: 1: Vector Asp (although he doesn't work with this guy quite right), 2: Your choice 2 mana Infect creature, 3: Cystbearer, 4: Hand of Praetors, and topping off at 5: Putrefax. Add in some Corpse Cur to sideboard against control and some Throne of Geth against agro; slant your mana base towards green, add some basic black removal, a dash of green pump, and you're good to go! :P

posts.post_content:
I don't understand why this card is so highly rated... I attempted to use this in my evasion/buff infect deck and it really just didn't feel that useful. I feel like I'm missing something, since this card is so highly rated and valued too.  
  
First, by the time you hit 4 mana, you've probably already played most of the infect creatures in your hand and the last ability becomes almost worthless, unless you're entirely creature focused. 90% of the infect decks I've seen are focused on evasion/buff and this card really doesn't have much of a place in those decks. +1/+1 is VERY nice, but, again... unless you're focused on mostly creatures, it doesn't help as much as a card that can stick it out in a fight.  
  
Second, this card is way too vulnerable to removal and it's not strong enough to attack (gets dropped by 1drop creatures a majority of the time). I don't mind playing a 1/1 infect and having it blasted away by a lightning bolt. However, if I pay 4 mana, I want something that sticks around... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

Second, this card is way too vulnerable to removal and it's not strong enough to attack (gets dropped by 1drop creatures a majority of the time).
